Template.name: name_of_step
Template.desc: There can be more than one video.

Getting Started.name: Creating a Counter
Getting Started.desc: In this video, we will be creating a simple starter project where we will have the computer count upwards forever as well as saying their name is Bob. Being an obedient dog, it will continue doing this until we tell it to stop.

Spritesheet Animation.value: In this tutorial, you will learn how to create a simple player controller, as well as animate a player using sprite sheets.

Spritesheet Animation.name: Introduction
Spritesheet Animation.desc: This video will give you an idea of what is to come. Download or Load the starter project below so that you can follow along!

Spritesheet Animation.name: Cropping and Modulus
Spritesheet Animation.desc: We will be going over how to 'cut' things out from images to create our animation. And will we also explain how modulus works and how it will be helpful for animating.

Spritesheet Animation.name: Single Animations
Spritesheet Animation.desc: We will now begin to create specific animations from our 'cut' image using the knowledge gained previously.

Spritesheet Animation.name: User Interaction
Spritesheet Animation.desc: Now we will create a simple player controller that will let the player move the character. Their animation's will also correspond to what they are doing!

Spritesheet Animation.name: Fliping an Image
Spritesheet Animation.desc: After you learn to flip any image, you can flip the character so that they face in the correct direction they're moving.

Spritesheet Animation.name: Jumping
Spritesheet Animation.desc: Finaly, we will add the 'jump' animation and complete the project.

Tile-Based Game.value: In this tutorial, we will construct a basic game loop to work for most games. We will use a sprite sheet to draw diverse worlds that you can create. It is suggested that you first complete our 'Sprite Animation' tutorial to first learn about sprit sheets, but it is not required.

Tile-Based Game.name: Introduction
Tile-Based Game.desc: This video will give you an idea of what is to come. Download or Load the starter project below so that you can follow along!

Tile-Based Game.name: Making a Tile Grid
Tile-Based Game.desc: We are going to use the 'explorer_tiles' spritesheet to create a simple tile grid that we can scroll around with the arrow keys.

Tile-Based Game.name: Editing the Tile Grid using Math
Tile-Based Game.desc: In this video, we are going to use simple math to edit the tile grid to no longer be perfectly uniform.

Tile-Based Game.name: Making a player controller
Tile-Based Game.desc: We will now be adding a simple player to our game. This player can move around the world, and scolls the screen when they get too close to the edge.

Tile-Based Game.name: Editing the Tile Grid using an Array
Tile-Based Game.desc: Using the new 'map' array, we can now create our own game worlds super easily. The game will read what is in the array, and using that information, generate the world acordingly.

Tile-Based Game.name: Player Collisions
Tile-Based Game.desc: In this video, we will finaly finish the basic project by adding player collisions. The player will no longer be able to pass through tiles set by the map array!
